str2: The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From lego; something said; by implication, a topic, also reasoning or motive; by extension, a computation; specially, the Divine Expression.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Singular
str2: A prolongation and middle voice form of a primary verb; to cause to be, i.e. to become, used with great latitude.
Flesh, body, human nature, materiality; kindred.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To dwell as in a tent, encamp, have my tabernacle. From skenos; to tent or encamp, i.e. to occupy or, to reside.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Middle - 1st Person Plural
str2: A prolonged form of a primary verb; to look closely at, i.e. perceive; by extension to visit.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
From the base of dokeo; glory, in a wide application.
From the base of dokeo; glory, in a wide application.
Probably adverb of comparative from hos; which how, i.e. In that manner.
Only, only-begotten; unique. From monos and ginomai; only-born, i.e. Sole.
Gen: from; dat: beside, in the presence of; acc: alongside of.
Father, (Heavenly) Father, ancestor, elder, senior. Apparently a primary word; a 'father'.
Full, abounding in, complete, completely occupied with. From pletho; replete, or covered over; by analogy, complete.
From chairo; graciousness, of manner or act.
And, even, also, namely.
From alethes; truth.
